displayName.text: Caren Shapiro- Lower East Side Psychotherapy

formattedAddress: Online Sessions Available, 477 FDR Dr, New York, NY 10002, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: Caren Shapiro- Lower East Side Psychotherapy

adrFormatAddress: Online Sessions Available, 477 FDR Dr, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
The past three years of working with Caren has turned out to be the most transformative years of my life both mentally and emotionally. I struggled with anxiety, depression, and engaged in harmful behaviors for years, and with the support of Caren, I am grateful to say that I have succeeded in resolving most of these challenges, and I am more confident and empathetic today than I am in any other periods of my life.

What I appreciate about Caren is that she is personable, professional, and effective. She was able to make a significant shift in my mentality and mood after just a few sessions. She is great at identifying issues and guiding me to their solutions. She is empathetic and made me feel supported during the more difficult moments of my life. Also, she is very accepting, and I felt very comfortable sharing the personal details of my life that needed to be resolved. In addition, I really appreciate that Caren cared about providing value in every one of our sessions; I never feel like I left a session without gaining something useful.

Engaging in therapy is a personal experience. You want to find a therapist who feels right for you. Caren was that person for me.

originalText.text:
Caren Shapiro-where to start? She is an amazing therapist-compassionate, very intuitive, patient, respectful and clearly loves what she does. In the six years we have worked together, she has been such an incredible, incredible support during the bumpiest of my life's rides.

Caren also has an amazing memory-she can remember details-people, places, events in your life that you yourself may have forgotten! This impressed me early on in our work together; she demonstrates that you are not just an appointment to check off on a calendar, but that you are someone who she will invest in.

Great therapists are few and far between (there are plenty of good ones, for sure, but great-not so many!)-I know, as I have had experiences with several others over the years-and Caren falls into this category. She is real (she will tell it like it is, she will keep it a "100"!!),  honest, and I will emphasize an adjective used above-compassionate! These qualities, along with others not noted here (this review can be much longer!) has made my time working with Caren feel productive and safe, and I always look forward to our sessions. Reach out to Caren-rest assured, you will be in good hands!

Reach out to Caren-rest assured, you will be in good hands!

originalText.text:
I’d tried so many other therapists before I met Caren; she was my last attempt before writing off therapy completely. I’ve been working with her for four years now, and my life has changed drastically. I came in so scared and shut down I could hardly talk, let alone share anything personal, but Caren was not deterred. With patience and encouragement she showed me I could trust her, and that nothing is off limits to talk about in the therapy room.

Caren truly cares and it comes through. She is real, and honest, and has a great sense of humor. You know you’re getting the “real” person, not a detached persona. She is totally present and engaged in each session, remembers what’s going on from week to week - in great detail! - and is able to recall and connect things that I brought up months or years ago.

She truly listens without judgement. Through our work, and after being on the receiving end of Caren’s genuine empathy and compassion, I have become decidedly more compassionate towards others myself.

Most importantly, Caren is always open to adjusting her approach to meet each client’s needs. She doesn’t get defensive when I say something isn’t working for me. I’ve learned that a misunderstanding doesn’t mean the end of a relationship, and that as long as I keep coming back, so will she, and we will always get through our hiccups and come out stronger and more connected on the other side.

If you’re reading with skepticism, as I did four years ago, I get it! But my experience has been so powerful, and my life, relationships, and perspective shifted so radically in a relatively short time, five stars seems inadequate! I wish everyone could have a chance to work with Caren.

originalText.text:
I have worked with Caren for over two years and the experience has been life-changing. She has helped me realize my deepest dreams in my career and personal life while providing a safe and empathetic space to process my most difficult emotions. Whatever we discuss, she always helps me keep an eye on my long-term goals, helping to immensely relieve my present anxieties.

With Caren, I have felt truly seen, heard and respected. She clearly cares deeply about the successes of her clients, and I cannot recommend her enough.

originalText.text: Caren is literally life changing. I started seeing her two years ago when I was at a very hard place in life, and the amount I've changed and grown in that time is incredible. As someone who has seen a lot of therapists over the years, Caren is truly the best therapist I've ever seen. I highly recommend her services.
